SubQuestions.Question: Are we bound to believe all the articles of the Christian faith?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must hold fast the form of sound words, 2 Tim. 1:13.

SubQuestions.Question: And to keep God's holy will and commandments?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we also should walk in newness of life, Rom. 6:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And to walk in the same all the days of our life?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed, John 8:31.

Data.Question: To whom is baptism to be administered?
Data.Answer: Baptism is not to be administered to any who are out of the visible church, till they profess their faith in Christ, and obedience to him; but the infants of such as are members of the visible church are to be baptized.

SubQuestions.Question: Are Jews and Pagans to be baptized upon their believing?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If thou believest with all thy heart, thou mayest, Acts 8:31.

SubQuestions.Question: Will their justifiable profession warrant the administering of baptism to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Simon Magus himself believed also and was baptized, Acts 8:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the children of believing parents to be baptized in their infancy?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For a seed shall serve him, it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation, Ps. 22:30.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it possible that they may be in covenant with God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For you have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, John 15:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it probable they should be in covenant?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For when Israel was a child, then I loved him, Hos. 11:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it certain they were in covenant?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will be a God to thee, and to thy seed, Gen. 17:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it therefore certain they are in covenant?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the blessing of Abraham comes upon the Gentiles, Gal. 3:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Does the seal of the covenant therefore belong to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Every man-child among you shall be circumcised, Gen. 17:10.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the children of Christians members of Christ's visible church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For of such is the kingdom of God, Mark 10:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Do the promises belong to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The promise is to you and to your children, Acts 2:39.

SubQuestions.Question: Does the promise of the Spirit belong to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will pour my Spirit upon thy seed, Isa. 44:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they capable of receiving it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: John was filled with the Holy Ghost from his mother's womb, Luke 1:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they then to be baptized?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For who can forbid water to them which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we? Acts 10:47.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the children of believers federally holy?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Else were your children unclean, but now are they holy, 1 Cor. 7:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they so in their parents' right?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If the root be holy, so are the branches, Rom. 11:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they disciples?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the yoke of circumcision was put upon the neck of the disciples, Acts 15:1,10.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they to be received in Christ's name?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Whosoever receiveth one such little child in my name, receiveth me, Matt. 18:5.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they born unto God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou hast taken thy sons and thy daughters, whom thou hast born unto me, Ezek. 16:20.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they bound by relation to be his servants?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I am thy servant the son of thine handmaid, Ps. 116:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Ought they then to be presented to him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The first-born of thy sons shalt thou give unto me, Exod. 22:29.

SubQuestions.Question: Do children need to be cleansed from the pollutions of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For they are shapen in iniquity, Ps. 51:5.

SubQuestions.Question: Is there provision made for their cleansing?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For there is a fountain opened to the house of David, Zech. 13:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the nations to be discipled by baptism?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Go ye and disciple all nations, baptizing them, Matt. 28:19.

SubQuestions.Question: Are children a part of the nations?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Your little ones stand here this day, to enter into covenant with God, Deut. 29:11,12.

SubQuestions.Question: And has Christ excepted them?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not, Matt. 19:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Were the families of believers baptized by the apostles?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lydia was baptized, and her household, Acts 16:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Did Christ himself receive the seal of the covenant in his infancy?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: When he was eight days old he was circumcised, Luke 2:21.

SubQuestions.Question: Is infant baptism useful for preserving the church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That our children may not cease from fearing the Lord, Josh. 22:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Was it a great mercy to you that you were baptized?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we are the children of the covenant, Acts 3:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we be careful to improve our baptism?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Be ye mindful always of his covenant, 1 Chron. 16:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a good argument against sin ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: How shall we that are dead to sin live any longer therein? Rom. 6:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And for holiness?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we also should walk in newness of life, Rom. 6:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a great encouragement to faith?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou art my God from my mother's belly, Ps. 22:10.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a good plea in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Save the son of thy handmaid, Ps. 86:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a strong inducement to brotherly love?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we all are baptized into one body, 1 Cor. 12:13.

Data.Question: What is the Lord's Supper?
Data.Answer: The Lord's Supper is a sacrament, wherein by giving and receiving bread and wine, according to Christ's appointment, his death is showed forth, and the worthy receivers are not, after a corporeal and carnal manner, but by faith, made partakers of his body and blood, with all his benefits, to their spiritual nourishment and growth in grace.

SubQuestions.Question: Was the Lord's Supper instituted by Christ himself?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I received of the Lord that which I delivered unto you, 1 Cor. 11:23.

SubQuestions.Question: Did he leave it as a legacy to his church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: It was in the night wherein he was betrayed, 1 Cor. 11:23.

SubQuestions.Question: Did he intend it should continue?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Till he come, 1 Cor. 11:26.

SubQuestions.Question: Is bread to be used in this sacrament?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he took bread, Matt 26:26.

SubQuestions.Question: And does that signify it to be a strengthening ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For bread strengthens man's heart, Ps. 104:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the cup to be used in this sacrament?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: He took the cup when he had supped, 1 Cor. 11:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Does that signify it to be a refreshing ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For wine makes glad the heart Ps. 104:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Must these be given and received?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Jesus took bread, and gave to them,--- took the cup, and gave it to them, Mark 14:22,23.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the people to partake of the cup?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Drink ye all of it, Matt. 26:27.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the ordinance doubled?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Because the thing is established, Gen. 41:32.

SubQuestions.Question: Does the bread signify the body of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: This is my body which is broken for you, 1 Cor. 11:21.

SubQuestions.Question: Does the wine signify the blood of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: This cup is the New Testament in my blood, Luke 22:20.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they turned into the very body and blood of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: For it is the Spirit that quickens, the flesh profits nothing, John 6:63.

SubQuestions.Question: But is the doctrine of Christ crucified meat and drink to a believing soul?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: My flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed, John 6:55.

SubQuestions.Question: And are we to feed upon that doctrine?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: He that eateth me, even he shall live by me, John 6:57.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the Lord's Supper a commemorating ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Do this in remembrance of me, Luke 22:19.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a confessing ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Ye do show the Lord's death, 1 Cor. 11:26.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a communicating ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? And the bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ? 1 Cor. 10:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a covenanting ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For it is the New Testament, 1 Cor. 11:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a confirming ordinance?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For Christ in it is evidently set forth, Gal. 3:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it an ordinance of communion with all Christians?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we have been all made to drink into one Spirit, 1 Cor. 12:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the pardon of sin sealed to believers in this sacrament?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: It is the blood of the New Testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins, Matt. 26:28.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the gift of the Holy Ghost sealed to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Receive ye the Holy Ghost, John 20:22.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the promise of eternal life sealed to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, Luke 22:30. Matt. 26:29.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we, by receiving this sacrament, bind ourselves out from all sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we reckon ourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, Rom. 6:11.

SubQuestions.Question: And do we bind ourselves up to all duty?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes; For being made free from sin, we become the servants of righteousness, Rom. 6:18.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the Lord's Supper a spiritual feast?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: A feast of fat things, of wines on the lees, Isa. 26:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a marriage-feast?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: A certain king made a marriage for his son, Matt. 26:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a feast upon a sacrifice?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Christ is sacrificed for us, let us keep the feast, 1 Cor. 5:7,8.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a feast upon a covenant?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: As Isaac made a feast for Abimelech when they swore one to another, Gen. 26:30,31.

SubQuestions.Question: Are all good Christians invited to this feast?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Come, for all things are now ready, Luke 14:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they often to partake of it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: As often as ye eat this bread, 1 Cor. 11:26.

Data.Question: What is required to the worthy receiving of the Lord's Supper?
Data.Answer: It is required of them who would worthily partake of the Lord's Supper, that they examine themselves of their knowledge to discern the Lord's body, of their faith to feed upon him, of their repentance, love, and new obedience, lest coming unworthily, they eat and drink judgment to themselves.

SubQuestions.Question: Are the ignorant to be admitted to the Lord's Supper?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: For they discern not the Lord's body, 1 Cor. 11:29.

SubQuestions.Question: Are those to be admitted to it who are openly profane?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: For what concord hath Christ with Belial? 2 Cor. 6:15.

SubQuestions.Question: But must all visible adult believers be admitted to it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: All the congregation of Israel shall keep the passover, Exod. 12:47.

SubQuestions.Question: Must those who come to the Lord's Supper prepare for it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must prepare our heart to seek God, the Lord God of our fathers, 2 Chron. 13:18.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we put away every sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Purge out the old leaven, 1 Cor. 5:7.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we cleanse ourselves from all pollutions?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will wash my hands in innocency, so I will compass thine altar, O Lord, Ps. 26:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we sequester ourselves from the world?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Tarry ye here, while I go yonder and worship, Gen. 22:5.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we apply ourselves seriously to this service?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must engage the heart to approach unto God, Jer. 30:21.

SubQuestions.Question: When we come to this ordinance must we examine ourselves?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of that cup, 1 Cor. 11:28.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we examine our spiritual state?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Examine yourselves whether ye be in the faith, 2 Cor. 13:5.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we examine our particular ways?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let us search and try our ways, Lam. 3:40.

SubQuestions.Question: Just we renew our repentance for sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For if we would judge ourselves, we shouldl not be judged, 1 Cor. 11:31.

SubQuestions.Question: And our faith in Christ crucified?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Who loved me and gave himself for me, Gal. 2:20.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we steadfastly purpose to lead a new life?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments, Ps. 119:106.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we be in charity with all men?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: First be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift, Matt. 5:24.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we stir up desires towards Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let him that is athirst come, Rev. 22:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we receive this sacrament with great reverence?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: In thy fear will I worship towards thy holy temple, Ps. 5:7.

SubQuestions.Question: And with fixedness of thought?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Bind the sacrifice with cords unto the horns of the altar, Ps. 118:27.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we receive it with godly sorrow for sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They shall look on me whom they have pierced, and mourn, Zech. 12:10.

SubQuestions.Question: And with holy joy in the Lord?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They did eat their meat with gladness, praising God, Acts 2:46,47.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we receive it with an affectionate remembrance of the love of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We will remember thy love more than wine, Cant. 1:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And with all earnest desire of mercy from God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the Lord, Ps. 116:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Must those who have received this sacrament be very watchful against all sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: He will speak peace to his people, and to his saints, but let them not turn again to folly, Ps. 85:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Must they abound in all duty?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will pay my vows unto the Lord, Ps. 116:14.

SubQuestions.Question: And must they ever preserve a sense of their engagements?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thy vows are upon me, O God, Ps. 56:12.

SubQuestions.Question: Do those who wilfully resolve to continue in sin receive unworthily?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For what hast thou to do to take my covenant in thy mouth, seeing thou hatest instruction, Ps. 50:16,17.

SubQuestions.Question: And do those receive unworthily who have no regard to Christ in what they do?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For they say the table of the Lord is contemptible, Mal. 1:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they that do so guilty of a great sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They are guilty of the body and blood of the Lord, 1 Cor. 11:27.

SubQuestions.Question: And are they in great danger?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For they eat aud drink judgment to themselves, 1 Cor. 11:29.

SubQuestions.Question: But shall weak believers, who bewail their unworthiness, be encouraged?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he will not break the bruised reed, Matt. 12:20.

Data.Question: What is prayer?
Data.Answer: Prayer is an offering up of our desires to God for things agreeable to his will, in the name of Christ, with confession of our sins, and thankful acknowledgment of his mercies.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it every one's duty to pray?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Men ought always to pray, Luke 18:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Call a man be a good man who lives without prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: Every one that is godly shall pray, Ps. 32:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray daily?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Morning, and evening, and at noon, will I pray, Ps. 55:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray continually?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Pray without ceasing, 1 Thess. 5:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray in secret?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and shut thy door, Matt. 6:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray when we are in affliction?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Is any among you afflicted, let him pray, James 5:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray to God only?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he only knows the hearts of all the children of men, 1 Kings 8:39.

SubQuestions.Question: May we pray to departed saints to pray for us?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: For Abraham is ignorant of us, Isa. 63:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Is prayer the soul's ascent to God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul, Ps. 25:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it the soul's converse with God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Pour out your hearts before him, Ps. 62:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we in prayer to ascribe glory to God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Give unto the Lord glory and strength, Ps. 96:7.

SubQuestions.Question: And to ask mercy of God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find, Matt. 7:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray to God for things agreeable to his will?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If we ask anything according to his will, he heareth us, 1 John 5:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for pardoning mercy, and sanctifying grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let us come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need, Heb. 4:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Are God's promises to be the guide of our desires in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Remember thy word unto thy servant, Ps. 119:49.

SubQuestions.Question: And the ground of our faith?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For I hope in thy word, Ps. 119:81.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray in the name of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, John 19:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Relying on his righteousness alone?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we have boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus, Heb. 10:19.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray in faith?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let him ask in faith, nothing wavering, Jam. 1:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Depending on the assistance of the Holy Spirit?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the Spirit helpeth our infirmities, Rom. 8:26.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we in prayer make confession of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I prayed to the Lord my God, and made my confession, Dan. 9:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we give thanks for mercies received?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, Ps. 100:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we be constant in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I gave myself unto prayer, Ps. 109:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And humble in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we are but dust and ashes, Gen. 18:27.

SubQuestions.Question: And earnest in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Always labouring fervently in prayer, Col 4:12.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we in sincerity set God before us in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let us draw near with a true heart, Heb. 10:22.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray in charity?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lifting up pure hands without wrath, 1 Tim. 2:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Will God hear and accept those who thus pray to him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: He never said to the seed of Jacob, seek ye me in vain, Isa. 45:19.

SubQuestions.Question: But will the love of sin spoil the success of prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If I regard iniquity in my heart, God will not hear me, Ps. 66:18.

Data.Question: What rule hath God given for our direction in prayer?
Data.Answer: The whole word of God is of use to direct us in prayer, but the special rule of direction is that form of prayer which Christ taught his disciples, commonly called, The Lord's Prayer.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we need direction in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we know not what we should pray for as we ought, Rom. 8:26.

SubQuestions.Question: Should we pray to God for direction?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lord, teach us to pray, Luke 11:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Hath he given us direction in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Take with you words, and turn to the Lord, Hos. 14:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the whole word of God of use to direct us?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will show thee that which is noted in the Scripture of truth, Dan. 10:21. compare 2 Chron. 9:23.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the Lord's Prayer to be used as a directory for prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: After this manner therefore pray ye, Matt. 6:9.

SubQuestions.Question: And is it to be used as a form of prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: When ye pray, say, Our Father, Luke 11:2.

Data.Question: What does the preface of the Lord's Prayer teach us?
Data.Answer: The preface of the Lord's Prayer, which is, Our Father which art in heaven, teaches us to draw near to God with all holy reverence and confidence, as children to a Father able and ready to help us, and that we should pray with and for others.

SubQuestions.Question: Is God our Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Doubtless thou art our Father, Isa. 63:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Does he appoint us to call him so?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My Father, thou art the guide of my youth, Jer. 3:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he our Father by creation?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Have we not all one Father? Hath not one God created us? Mal. 2:10.

SubQuestions.Question: And by redemption?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Is not he thy Father that bought thee? Deut. 32:6.

SubQuestions.Question: And by adoption?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will be a Father to them, 2 Cor. 6:18.

SubQuestions.Question: Is God a wise Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The Father of lights, Jam. 1:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he a gracious Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The Father of mercies, 2 Cor. 1:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he our soul's Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The Father of spirits, Heb. 12:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I bow my knee to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, Eph. 3:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he in him our Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I ascend to my Father, and your Father, John 20:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we in prayer to call God Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes; Crying Abba, Father, Gal. 4:6.

SubQuestions.Question: And to esteem him as a Father?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will arise and go to my Father, and say unto him, Father, Luke 15:18.

SubQuestions.Question: And is this comfortable in prayer?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For with thee the fatherless find mercy, Hos. 14:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Is God our Father in heaven?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the Lord's throne is in heaven, Ps. 11:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Is heaven a high place?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: And we must lift up our hearts with our hands to God in the heavens, Lam. 3:41.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a holy place?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: And we must lift up holy hands, 1 Tim. 2:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a place of prospect?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: And therefore our Father sees in secret, Matt. 6:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it a place of power?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: And therefore he is able to do above all that we ask or think, Eph. 3:20.

SubQuestions.Question: Ought we therefore to pray with reverence?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For God is in heaven, and we upon earth, Eccl. 5:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And with holy confidence?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For we have boldness and access with confidence, Eph. 3:12.

SubQuestions.Question: For is God a Father who is able to help us?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: My Father is greater than all, John 10:29.

SubQuestions.Question: Does he know our wants?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Your heavenly Father knows that ye have need of all these things, Matt. 6:32.

SubQuestions.Question: Is he willing to help?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the Father himself loveth you, John 16:27.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray with others?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: There were many gathered together praying, Acts 12:12.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for others?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must make supplication for all saints, Eph. 6:18.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the first petition?
Data.Answer: In the first petition, which is, Hallowed be thy Name, we pray, that God would enable us, and others, to glorify him in all that whereby he maketh himself known, and that he would dispose all things to his own glory.

SubQuestions.Question: Ought we to desire the glory of God in the first place?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That God in all things may be glorified, 1 Pet. 4:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Is God glorified when his name is glorified?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They shall worship before thee, O Lord, and shall glorify thy name, Ps. 86:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Is God's name glorified when it is sanctified or hallowed?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he is glorious in holiness, Exod. 15:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Ought we therefore to sanctify it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, 1 Pet. 3:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray that we ourselves may be enabled to glorify God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Open thou my lips and my mouth shall show forth thy praise, Ps. 51:15.

SubQuestions.Question: And that we may live for that end?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, Ps. 119:175.

SubQuestions.Question: And be delivered for that end?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Bring my soul out of prison that I may praise thy name, Ps. 142:7.

SubQuestions.Question: And are we to pray that others also may he enabled to glorify him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That they may glorify our Father which is in heaven, Matt. 5:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we here pray for the propagating of the knowledge of God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations, Ps. 67:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the conversion of souls to him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let the people praise thee, O God, let all the people praise thee Ps. 67:3.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the success of the gospel?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, 2 Thess. 3:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we pray for the fruitfulness of Christians?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That they may be filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God, Phil. 1:11.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the flourishing of the churches of Christ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That they may be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that he might be glorified, Isa. 61:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we pray that God would glorify himself?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Father, glorify thy name, John 12:28.

SubQuestions.Question: And are we sure he will do it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For there came a voice from heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and I will glorify it yet again, John 12:28.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we pray that he would exalt his own name?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thine own strength, Ps. 21:13.

SubQuestions.Question: And are we sure he will do it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth, Ps. 46:10.

SubQuestions.Question: May we plead this with him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: What wilt thou do to thy great name? Josh 7:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we pray that God would bring glory to himself out of all events?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: To thy name give glory, Ps. 115:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Even out of those events that seem contrary?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That the wrath of man may praise him, Ps. 76:10.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we desire it concerning ourselves?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may be unto him for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory, Jer. 13:11.

SubQuestions.Question: And concerning all our affairs?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That Christ may be magnified in my body both by life and death, Phil. 1:20.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the second petition?
Data.Answer: In the second petition, which is, Thy kingdom come, we pray, that Satan's kingdom may be destroyed, and that the kingdom of grace may be advanced, ourselves and others brought into it, and kept in it, and that the kingdom of glory may be hastened.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we acknowledge our heavenly Father's kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The Lord is king for ever and ever, Ps. 10:16.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we admire it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must speak of the glory of his kingdom, Ps. 145:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we own him to be our King?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou art my king, O God, Ps. 44:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we heartily wish well to his kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Seek ye first the kingdom of God, Matt. 6:33.

SubQuestions.Question: Has Satan a kingdom in opposition to God's kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he is the prince of this world, John 12:31.

SubQuestions.Question: Does he rule where sin rules?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he works in the children of disobedience, Eph. 2:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that that kingdom may be destroyed?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The Lord rebuke thee, O Satan, even the Lord that has chosen Jerusalem, rebuke thee, Zech. 3:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that the dominion of sin may be broken?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: O let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, Ps. 7:9.

SubQuestions.Question: And that the power of the church's enemies may be crushed?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: So let all thine enemies perish, O Lord, Judg. 5:31.

SubQuestions.Question: And their policies blasted?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lord turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness, 2 Sam. 15:31.

SubQuestions.Question: And their projects defeated?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: O my God, make them like a wheel, Ps. 83:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Have we reason to hope that Satan's kingdom shall be destroyed in the hearts of believers?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the God of peace shall tread Satan under your feet shortly, Rom. 16:20.

SubQuestions.Question: And that it shall be destroyed in the world?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven, Luke 10:18.

SubQuestions.Question: So destroyed that it shall not destroy the church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the church is built upon a rock, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it, Matt. 16:18.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the kingdom of Christ our Father's kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I have set my King upon my holy hill of Zion, Ps. 2:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that that may be advanced?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Prayer shall be made for him continually, Ps. 72:15.

SubQuestions.Question: That we and others may be brought into it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That Christ may dwell in your heart by faith, Eph. 3:17.

SubQuestions.Question: And kept in it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may be preserved blameless to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, 1 Thess. 5:23.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for converting grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Turn thou me, and I shall be turned, Jer. 31:18.

SubQuestions.Question: And that others may partake of that grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That sinners may be converted unto thee, Ps. 51:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for confirming grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That God would comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work, 2 Thess. 2:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for the strengthening of faith?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lord, increase our faith, Luke 17:5.

SubQuestions.Question: And the increase of love?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: This I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more, Phil. 1:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for the advancement of the kingdom of light?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: O send out thy light and thy truth, Ps. 43:3.

SubQuestions.Question: And the kingdom of holiness?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The God of peace sanctify you wholly, 1 Thess. 5:23.

SubQuestions.Question: And the kingdom of love?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That they all may be one, John 17:21.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for the sending forth of ministers in order hereunto?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Pray the Lord of the harvest that he would send forth labourers into his harvest, Matt. 9:38.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the presence of God with them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That utterance may be given to them, Eph. 6:19.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for the prosperity of the church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem, Ps. 122:6.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the welfare of all who belong to it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee, Ps. 70:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the comfort of all good Christians?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity, Eph. 6:24.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for the enlargement of the church?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: My heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they may be saved, Rom. 10:1.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the reformation of it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts, Ps. 80:19.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the defence of it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Build thou the walls of Jerusalem, Ps. 51:18.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the deliverance of it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Command deliverances for Jacob, Ps. 44:4.

SubQuestions.Question: May we pray in faith for the advancement and continuance of Christ's kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For of the increase of his government and peace there shall be no end, Isa. 9:7.

SubQuestions.Question: And have we reason to triumph in this?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Hallelujah, for the Lord God omnipotent reigneth, Rev. 19:6.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the kingdom of glory yet to come?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: When the mystery of God shall be finished, Rev. 10:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray that that may be hastened?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Looking for, and hastening unto, the coming of the day of God, 2 Pet. 3:12.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to desire our own removal to that glory at death?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven, 2 Cor. 5:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray that we may be ready for it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Watch therefore, and pray always, Luke 21:36.

SubQuestions.Question: And then that it may be hastened?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, Luke 2:29.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for Christ's second coming at the end of time?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Amen, even so come, Lord Jesus, Rev. 22:20.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the third petition?
Data.Answer: In the third petition, which is, Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven, we pray that God by his grace would make us able and willing to know, obey, and submit to his will in all things, as the angels do in heaven.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the will of God's commands the rule of our action?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We must understand what the will of the Lord is, Eph. 5:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray that we may conform to this rule?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may prove what is the good, and acceptable, and perfect will of God, Rom. 12:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that God would give us to know his will?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law, Ps. 119:34.

SubQuestions.Question: And to know it fully?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That ye may be filled with the knowledge of his will, Col. 1:9.

SubQuestions.Question: And to know it in doubtful cases?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Teach me thy way, O Lord, lead me in a plain path, Ps. 27:11.

SubQuestions.Question: So all who are sanctified truly desire to know God's will?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: What saith my Lord unto his servant? Josh. 5:14.

SubQuestions.Question: When we know God's will, are we able of ourselves to do it?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: We are not sufficient of ourselves, 2 Cor. 3:5.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we therefore pray to God to make us able?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Now, therefore, O God, strengthen my hands, Neh. 6:9.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we depend upon his grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will go in the strength of the Lord God, Ps. 71:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray to God to make us willing?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, Ps. 119:36.

SubQuestions.Question: And to make us entirely willing?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Unite my heart to fear thy name, Ps. 36:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that we may be sincere in our obedience?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let my heart be sound in thy statutes, Ps. 119:80.

SubQuestions.Question: And that we may be exact in our obedience?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: O that my ways were directed to keep thy commandments! Ps. 119:5.

SubQuestions.Question: And that we may be universal in our obedience?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may stand complete in all the will of God, Col. 4:12.

SubQuestions.Question: And that we may be armed against that which would divert us from our obedience?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity, and quicken thou me in thy way, Ps. 119:37.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we pray that others also may do God's will?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That they may be perfect in every good work, to do his will, Heb. 13:21.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the will of God's counsel the rule of his actions?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he worketh all according to the counsel of his own will, Eph. 1:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we desire that this may be done?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: The will of the Lord be done, Acts 21:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Rather than our own will?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Not as I will, but as thou wilt, Matt. 26:39.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we acquiesce in it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: It is the Lord, let him do what seemeth him good, 1 Sam. 3:18.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we pray that he will enable us to do so?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may be strengthened with all might, unto all patience and longsuffering, with joyfulness, Col. 1:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Do the angels in heaven do the will of God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They do his commandments, hearkening to the voice of his word, Ps. 103:20.

SubQuestions.Question: Do they do it readily?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: They fly swiftly, Dan. 9:21.

SubQuestions.Question: Do they do it zealously?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For they are a flaming fire, Ps. 104:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Do they do it with an eye to God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For they always behold the face of our Father, Matt. 18:10.

SubQuestions.Question: And are we to pray that God's will may so be done on earth?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That the kingdoms of this world may become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ, Rev. 11:15.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
Data.Answer: In the fourth petition, which is, Give us this day our daily bread, we pray, that of God's free gift we may receive a competent portion of the good things of this life, and enjoy his blessing with them.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for the good things of this life?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the Lord is for the body, 1 Cor. 6:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we go to God for them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things, Acts 17:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we go to him for the comfort of them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he gives us richly all things to enjoy, 1 Tim. 6:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we deserve the good things of this life?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: We are less than the least of all God's mercies, Gen. 32:10.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we therefore beg them of God as a free gift?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: God gives the dew of heaven, Gen. 27:28.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for riches?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: Lest we be full, and say who is the Lord? Prov. 30:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for dainties?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: Be not desirous of dainties, for they are deceitful meat, Prov. 23:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to be content with such a competent portion of these things as God sees fit for us?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Having food and raiment, let us be therewith content, 1 Tim. 6:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for that?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Feed me with food convenient for me, Prov. 30:8.

SubQuestions.Question: And need we desire any more?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: If God will be with me, and keep me in the way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on, so that I come to my heavenly Father's house in peace, then the Lord shall be my God, Gen. 28:20, 21.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray each day for the bread of the day?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself, Matt 6:34.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we pray for our bread honestly gotten?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For with quietness we must work, and eat our own bread, 2 Thess. 3:12.

SubQuestions.Question: And have we encouragement to pray for this?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For godliness hath the promise of the life that now is, 1 Tim. 4:8.

SubQuestions.Question: Do we herein pray for health?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For God is our life, and the length of our days, Deut. 30:20.

SubQuestions.Question: And for success in our callings?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Establish thou the work of our hands upon us, Ps. 90:17.

SubQuestions.Question: And for sleep?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For so he giveth his beloved sleep, Ps. 127:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And for seasonable weather?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Ask ye of the Lord rain, Zech. 10:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for God's blessing on what we have?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For man liveth not by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God, Matt. 4:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And is it then comfortable to us?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer, 1 Tim. 4:5.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray most earnestly for bread for our souls?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Lord, evermore give us that bread, John 6:34.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for others' prosperity, as well as for our own?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I wish that thou mayest prosper, and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth, 3 John 1:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And for the supply of the poor and needy?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That he will abundantly bless our provision, and satisfy our poor with bread, Ps. 132:15.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
Data.Answer: In the fifth petition, which is, And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors, we pray, that God, for Christ's sake, would freely pardon all our sins; which we are the rather encouraged to ask, because by his grace we are enabled from the heart to forgive others.

SubQuestions.Question: Are our sins our debts to God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: There was a certain creditor that had two debtors, etc. Luke 7:41.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they great debts?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Ten thousand talents, Matt. 18:24.

SubQuestions.Question: Can we discharge these debts ourselves ?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: We have nothing to pay, Luke 7:42.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we liable to the prison of hell then?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Not to depart thence till we have paid the last mite, Luke 12:58,59.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it possible to obtain the forgiveness of this debt?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: There is forgiveness with thee, Ps. 130:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to pray for the forgiveness of these debts?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Enter not into judgment with thy servant, O Lord, Ps. 143:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And to pray earnestly for it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For thy name's sake, O Lord, pardon mine iniquity, Ps. 25:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we plead God's mercies?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: According to the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions, Ps. 51:1.

SubQuestions.Question: And Christ's merits?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Through the redemption that is in Jesus, Rom. 3:24.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray for it every day?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: When we pray, Give us our daily bread, we must pray, Forgive us our debts.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that God would ease us of the burden of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Take away all iniquity, Hos. 14:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And that he would cleanse us from the filth of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, Ps. 51:2.

SubQuestions.Question: And cure us of the wounds of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee, Ps. 12:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And save us from the punishment of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will say unto God, do not condemn me, Job 10:2.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray to God to give us that grace which will qualify us for pardon?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For Christ is exalted to give repentance and remission, Acts 5:31.

SubQuestions.Question: And that he would give us the comfort of our pardon?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Make me to hear joy and gladness, Ps. 51:8.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we, in order hereunto, be particular in confessing sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Declare, that thou mayest be justified, Isa. 43:26.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we forgive those who have provoked us?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any, Col. 3:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we bear them no malice?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye he condemned, Jam. 5:9.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we be ready to be reconciled to them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: When ye stand praying, forgive if ye have ought against any, Mark 11:25.

SubQuestions.Question: Should we be merciful to those that we have advantage against?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou shouldest have had compassion on thy fellow-servant as I had pity on thee, Matt. 18:33.

SubQuestions.Question: Is this required to qualify, us for the pardon of sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: If Ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you, Matt. 6:14.

SubQuestions.Question: Will God forgive those that do not forgive?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: If ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive yours, Matt. 6:15.

Data.Question: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
Data.Answer: In the sixth petition, which is, And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil, we pray, that God would either keep us from being tempted to sin, or support and deliver us when we are tempted.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that we may not be tempted?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation, Matt. 26:41.

SubQuestions.Question: And that temptations may be removed?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me, 2 Cor. 12:8.

SubQuestions.Question: And that we may not be overcome by them?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let no iniquity have dominion over me, Ps. 119:133.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that God would not leave us to ourselves?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, Ps. 141:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And that he would not withdraw the assistance of his grace?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Take not thy Holy Spirit away from me, Ps. 51:11.

SubQuestions.Question: But that he would strengthen us against every temptation?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Uphold me with by free spirit, Ps. 51:12.

SubQuestions.Question: And that he would preserve us through it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That our faith fail not, Luke 22:32.

SubQuestions.Question: Have we encouragement to pray against temptation?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For God is faithful, who will not suffer us to be tempted above what we are able, 1 Cor. 10:13.

SubQuestions.Question: And is prayer a part of our spiritual armour ?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Praying always, Eph. 6:13,18.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we dread sin as the worst evil?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, Neh. 6:13.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we pray to be kept from it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: To be delivered from every evil work, 2 Tim. 4:18.

SubQuestions.Question: And from all occasions of it?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity, Ps. 119:37.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray against pride?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That he may hide pride from man, Job 33:17.

SubQuestions.Question: And against lying?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Remove from me the way of lying, Ps. 119:29.

SubQuestions.Question: And against sensuality?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let me not eat of their dainties, Ps. 140:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And against uncleanness?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Create in me a clean heart, O God, Ps. 51:10.

SubQuestions.Question: And against covetousness?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Incline my heart to thy testimonies, and not to covetousness, Ps. 119:36.

SubQuestions.Question: And against all tongue-sins?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Set a watch, O Lord, before the door of my mouth, keep the door of my lips, Ps. 141:3.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray especially against wilful sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Keep back thy servant from presumptuous sins, Ps. 19:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray that others also may be kept from sin?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I pray to God that ye do no evil, 2 Cor. 13:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we pray to be delivered from other evil?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Keep me from evil that it may not grieve me, 1 Chron. 4:10.

SubQuestions.Question: Must our eye be to God for our preservation?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Hide me under the shadow of thy wings, Ps. 17:8.

SubQuestions.Question: May we take encouragement in this prayer from God's power?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For he is able to keep that which we have committed to him, 2 Tim. 1:12.

SubQuestions.Question: And from his promise?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: There shall no evil befall thee, Ps. 91:10.

SubQuestions.Question: And from our own experience?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: He that has delivered does deliver, in whom we trust that he will yet deliver, 2 Cor. 1:10.

Data.Question: What does the conclusion of the Lord's Prayer teach us?
Data.Answer: The conclusion of the Lord's Prayer, which is, For thine is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, forever, Amen, teaches us to take our encouragement in prayer from God only, and in our prayers to praise him, ascribing kingdom, power, and glory to him; and in testimony of our desire and assurance to be heard, we say, Amen.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we in prayer to plead with God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments, Job 23:4.

SubQuestions.Question: Are our pleadings to move God?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: For he is in one mind, and who can turn him, Job 23:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Are they to move ourselves?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: That we may stir up ourselves to take hold on God, Isa. 64:7.

SubQuestions.Question: Can we in prayer plead any merit of our own?
SubQuestions.Answer: No: We do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousness, Dan. 9:18.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we therefore take our encouragement from God only?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Defer not for thine own sake, O my God, Dan. 9:19.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we depend on that encouragement?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee, Ps. 39:7.

SubQuestions.Question: May we plead that his is the kingdom?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Art not thou God in heaven? and rulest not thou over all the kingdoms of the heathen? 2 Chron. 20:6.

SubQuestions.Question: And that his is the power?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: There is nothing too hard for thee, Jer. 32:17.

SubQuestions.Question: And that his is the glory?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name, Ps. 79:9.

SubQuestions.Question: May we also plead his mercy?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Save me for thy mercy's sake, Ps. 6:4.

SubQuestions.Question: And his promise?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Remember thy word unto thy servant, Ps. 119:49.

SubQuestions.Question: And our own experience of his goodness?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou hast delivered my soul from death, wilt thou not deliver my feet from falling? Ps. 56:13.

SubQuestions.Question: But must we especially plead the mediation of his Son?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Look upon the face of thine Anointed, Ps. 84:9.

SubQuestions.Question: And may we hope to prevail in these pleadings?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: For the effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much, Jam. 5:16.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it God's grace in us which alone qualifies us for his favour?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thou wilt prepare their heart, and then thou wilt cause thine ear to hear. Ps. 10:17.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we in prayer to praise God?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Every day will I bless thee, Ps. 145.

SubQuestions.Question: Are we to ascribe kingdom, power, and glory to him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sits upon the throne, Rev. 5:13.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we acknowledge them to be his?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thine, O Lord, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty, 1 Chron. 29:11.

SubQuestions.Question: Must we acknowledge them to be his for ever?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, Ps. 145:13.

SubQuestions.Question: And must we desire to be for ever praising him?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being, Ps. 104:33.

SubQuestions.Question: Is the work of praise good work?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: It is pleasant, and praise is comely, Ps. 147:1.

SubQuestions.Question: Does Amen signify our desire to be heard?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: So be it, O Lord, Jer. 11:5.

SubQuestions.Question: And our hope that we shall be heard?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: We know that we have the petitions that we desired of him, 1 John 5:15.

SubQuestions.Question: Is it therefore proper to conclude our prayers and praises with Amen?
SubQuestions.Answer: Yes: Let all the people say, Amen. Hallelujah, Ps. 106:48.
